intro: Ardisia brackenridgei, commonly known as the Brackenridge’s Christmasberry, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, dark red berries that are typically produced in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. It has elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces fragrant flowers that are white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
